sn11.18:4.4: “Once upon a time, mendicants, Sakka, Lord of Gods, addressed his charioteer Mātali:
sn11.18:4.5: ‘My dear Mātali, harness the chariot with its team of a thousand thoroughbreds.
sn11.18:4.6: We will go to a park and see the nice scenery.’
sn11.18:4.7: ‘Yes, lord,’ replied Mātali. He harnessed the chariot and informed Sakka:
sn11.18:4.8: ‘Good sir, the chariot with its team of a thousand thoroughbreds has been harnessed.
sn11.18:4.10: Then Sakka descended from the Palace of Victory, raised his cupped palms, and revered the different quarters.
sn11.18:4.11: So Mātali the charioteer addressed Sakka in verse:
